GET /accounts/{account_id}/urlscanner/v2.description: Returns a plain text response, with the scan's DOM content as rendered by Chrome.

200.description: Returns a plain text response, with the scan's DOM content as rendered by Chrome.

message.description: Scan not found or in progress.

GET /accounts/{account_id}/urlscanner/v2.description: Returns the raw response of the network request. Find the `response_id` in the `data.requests.response.hash`.

200.description: Get the raw response by its hash.
Scan has finished. It may or may not have been successful.

message.description: Scan not found or in progress.

404.description: Scan not found or in progress.

message.description: Scan not found or in progress.

404.description: Scan not found or in progress.

GET /accounts/{account_id}/urlscanner/v2.description:
Use a subset of ElasticSearch Query syntax to filter scans. Some example queries:

- 'path:"/bundles/jquery.js"': Searches for scans who requested resources with the given path.
- 'page.asn:AS24940 AND hash:xxx': Websites hosted in AS24940 where a resource with the given hash was downloaded.
- 'page.domain:microsoft* AND verdicts.malicious:true AND NOT page.domain:microsoft.com': malicious scans whose hostname starts with "microsoft".
- 'apikey:me AND date:[2025-01 TO 2025-02]': my scans from 2025 January to 2025 February.

parameters.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
parameters.name: size

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/urlscanner/v.description: Submit URLs to scan. Check limits at https://developers.cloudflare.com/security-center/investigate/scan-limits/ and take into account scans submitted in bulk have lower priority and may take longer to finish.

schema.description: List of urls to scan (up to a 100).

screenshotsResolutions.description: Take multiple screenshots targeting different device types.

visibility.description: The option `Public` means it will be included in listings like recent scans and search results. `Unlisted` means it will not be included in the aforementioned listings, users will need to have the scan's ID to access it. A a scan will be automatically marked as unlisted if it fails, if it contains potential PII or other sensitive material.

detail.example: DNS Error - Could not resolve domain.

title.example: DNS Error - Could not resolve domain.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/urlscanner/v.description: Submit a URL to scan. Check limits at https://developers.cloudflare.com/security-center/investigate/scan-limits/.

screenshotsResolutions.description: Take multiple screenshots targeting different device types.

visibility.description: The option `Public` means it will be included in listings like recent scans and search results. `Unlisted` means it will not be included in the aforementioned listings, users will need to have the scan's ID to access it. A a scan will be automatically marked as unlisted if it fails, if it contains potential PII or other sensitive material.

url.description: Canonical form of submitted URL. Use this if you want to later search by URL.
